com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl

Class VertexArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.Creatable
      • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl.VertexArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GLVersioned
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GL20VertexArray, GL30VertexArray

    public abstract class VertexArray
extends Creatable
implements GLVersioned
    Represent an OpenGL vertex array. The vertex data must be set with setData(com.flowpowered.caustic.api.data.VertexData) before it can be created.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  VertexArray.DrawingMode
      Represents the different drawing modes for the vertex array
      static class  VertexArray.PolygonMode
      Represents the different polygon modes for the vertex array

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from class: Creatable
        Releases the resource. It can not longer be used.
        Overrides:
        destroy in class Creatable

      • setData

        public abstract void setData(VertexData vertexData)
        Sets the vertex data source to use. The indices offset is kept but maybe reduced if it doesn't fit inside the new data. The count is set to the size from the offset to the end of the data.
        Parameters:
        vertexData - The vertex data source

      • setDrawingMode

        public abstract void setDrawingMode(VertexArray.DrawingMode mode)
        Sets the vertex array's drawing mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - The drawing mode to use

      • setPolygonMode

        public abstract void setPolygonMode(VertexArray.PolygonMode mode)
        Sets the vertex array's polygon mode. This describes how to rasterize each primitive. The default is VertexArray.PolygonMode.FILL. This can be used to draw only the wireframes of the polygons.
        Parameters:
        mode - The polygon mode

      • setIndicesOffset

        public abstract void setIndicesOffset(int offset)
        Sets the starting offset in the indices buffer. Defaults to 0.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset in the indices buffer

      • setIndicesCount

        public abstract void setIndicesCount(int count)
        Sets the number of indices to render during each draw call, starting at the offset set by setIndicesOffset(int). Setting this to a value smaller than zero results in rendering of the whole list. If the value is larger than the list (starting at the offset), it will be maxed to that value.
        Parameters:
        count - The number of indices

      • draw

        public abstract void draw()
        Draws the primitives defined by the vertex data.

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Gets the ID for this vertex array as assigned by OpenGL.
        Returns:
        The ID
